title: Leagues Most Famous Player Doesn't Use Skins
body:
I find it ironic that LoL makes it's money from selling champion skins, but the game's most famous player (Faker) doesn't use them. The only reason I buy skins is to support the game, most of the time I could take them or leave them.

What do you think?

replies.body: That probably means he has a budget that he sticks to.
His budget is massive though, he just won worlds.
Having lots of money isn't the same thing as having a big budget.
That statement is true in theory, but you're telling me he cant afford $2000 in skins? That would cover at least on per champion.

I don't pretend to know his finances. There could be any number of reasons he choses not to buy skins.

While we can say "Faker isn't supporting LoL", that's actually the most incorrect assumption one can make. LCS itself is a net loss for Riot, but it is used to advertise and draw in players. I'd say Faker draws in far more players than $2000 worth.

While I agree with what you're saying I didn't say "Faker isn't supporting LoL": what I mean is that in some way he _could_ be setting a precedent, which is more of an ironic point of interest, rather than an absolute statement about whether or not Faker is a benefit to Riot. 

It's just kind of funny, isn't it? :D
